  • @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl]派出了自己的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.FGTkYLckkrJkQzDV]{拟像术}：一个 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ZQTCZfTV9ZoTjNCU]{造妖} 和川流。他们带了一瓶 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.rTn4p9nJr4Aq2GPB]{隐身药水} 和一张 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.TCj9jgRFD7GWln6v]{任意门}的卷轴，并会在冲突爆发的一瞬间逃跑。
  • @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] 派来了一个由@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.mgCuGXIkY8BWmLeh]{支配类人} 法术控制的诱饵。这个可怜虫被同时用物理手段和@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.XzrRVuH9jNbuiN4t]{伪装术} 乔装了起来，并且盗贼女王会直接控制这个倒霉蛋，让她表现的就像是她本人一样。她会安排她的间谍和刺客们对较弱的派系领袖或玩家角色发动暗杀。不过，@UUID[Actor.btuo8mywkRo5g6M9] 不会参加这次行动。
  • 艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔，希奥多·马歇尔和 @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 会带着自己派系的大批人马来到附近，准备在发生暴力事件时突入教堂。

所有的派系领袖都清楚地知道随时可能爆发冲突，但事实上，他们全都不愿意在这里开战。在讨论过程中，派系领袖会提出下列关键问题：

  • 玩家角色们的真实动机是什么？他们到底站在哪一边？
  • 哪个派系能够取得大教堂的控制权？
  • 如何处理王室档案？
  • 谁将持有目前已经取得的德拉肯海姆信物？将由谁来统治德拉肯海姆？
  • 妄质应该如何处理？

在会议期间，应当充分各派系的特点，它们各自的目标，以及派系领袖的形象。在冲突中要划分出明确的界线，不要害怕对角色们当场发难：每个派系的领袖都应该至少有一次直接向每位玩家角色提出某个尖锐的问题。

残忍的背(可选)： 如果玩家角色们在会议前就与其中一个派系之间产生了极大的矛盾，那么该派系就会在会议前秘密调动数支精锐突击队待命，或者在大教堂地下埋设大威力的炸药。他们还为自己的领袖精心设计了一个逃跑计划（对于学院或盗贼女王来说，这就并不重要了，因为他们都是以代理出席的）。在会议期间，领袖会要求得到所有的 德拉肯海姆信物 、圣维特鲁维奥的遗物、大教堂的控制权，或者其他任何适合该派系的疯狂的最后通牒。如果他们的要求没有得到满足，他们的部队就会发起攻击，或者引爆炸药，产生类似@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.nkgNj5H4VtY7bKui]{流星爆} 水平的大爆炸，这场爆炸会席卷整座教堂并导致屋顶和穹顶坍塌。

重燃火祭盆

@UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 和 @UUID[Actor.1IaDUyBM9G4EEphL] 都会提议重新点燃神圣之火祭盆，并重新为大教堂进行祝圣仪式。这需要一些圣人的骨灰或骨片：圣维特鲁维奥本人或者金龙阿贡纳斯的遗骨皆可，这些都可以在大教堂的地下墓穴中找到。如果火祭盆被重新点燃，大教堂的烛台就会在该区域内产生类似于@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SLxA9QhrggTz0taU]{圣居} 以及 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.64D1gNZ4hx7SWG2x]{禁制术} 的效果，并且可以成为在城市中对抗污霭的圣所，角色们也可以在这里正常休息。

如果大教堂被炸毁，火祭盆会被摧毁且无法再被重新点燃。

事后余波

大教堂仍然会是竞相争夺的热点地区：无论谈判结果如何，天火信众和白银骑士团都会在会议结束后试图从对方手中夺取大教堂。如果覆影明灯或盗贼女王无法从冯·凯赛尔家族宝库中获取情报，他们也会发起反击来抢夺这些信息。

任何守住了大教堂的派系都可以在此建立一个不算稳固的安全据点，但这样做会导致派系的兵力捉襟见肘。不过，玩家角色可以将这里作为他们的行动基地。最终，除非玩家角色采取行动赶走敌方派系并完成盟友的主要目标，否则每个派系都会在坚守大教堂超过 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) 周后就因兵力不断削减而难以为继这里的控制权。夺取大教堂给玩家角色们提供了一个重要的机会，但他们必须及时抓住这个机会。

[10] 阿贡纳斯安息处

旋转楼梯延着宽阔的石井向下盘旋延伸，最终抵达一处巨大的天然洞窟。洞窟内弥漫着令人窒息的硫磺气味。在一个冒着油泡的池子里，安置着一条巨龙的古老遗骸。它巨大的骸骨上还残留有金色的甲鳞，但其他部分早已腐烂。

  • 这个空间内被施加了@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.64D1gNZ4hx7SWG2x]{禁制术} ，生物无法传送进入这里。
  • 有一处碑文写道：“这是我的战友，阿贡纳斯。除非末日的黑暗吞噬德拉肯海姆，否则谁也不能打扰他的安息。”
  • 在这个区域内携带明火是个非常坏的主意。
  • 这些是远古金龙 ancient gold dragon，阿贡纳斯的遗骸。只要使用卡达斯山宝钻或者原始妄质晶簇作为施法材料，使用法术位施放一个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.xv4KUJoLQAYzGZGK]{复生术}，就能让巨龙复活。此后，巨龙就会在此沉眠，除非得到持有圣维特鲁维奥的所有遗物的人的命令。
  • 楼梯旁的石井与上方的大教堂地板相接。如果阿贡纳斯复活，他就会向石井上方飞去，冲破地板离开地下。

Slaughterstone Square.name: 戮石广场
Slaughterstone Square.text:
戮石广场

戮石广场是德拉肯海姆城区的一个重要路口——这里的街道纵横交错，向北通往德拉肯城堡，向东通向国王门，向南通向横跨德兰河的一座桥，向西通往集市广场。数世纪之前，这个广场曾是旧城区的核心地带，这里是许多主要集市的所在地，也曾被人们称作旗石广场。随着城市发展，这里成为了市政中心，并最终变为了公开处决犯人的地 方 。 这个广场现在的名字真是再合适不过了。@UUID[Actor.4UrBZVZ2pkfwy8h3] 仍然占据着这个广场：它是一个笨重的发条骑士，专门用来执行死刑。由于受到了污霭的污染，这台狂暴的机器现在会凶残地屠戮任何胆敢经过戮石广场的人。

总览 Overview

戮石广场位于蓄水池上方，因此如果你的角色们正在寻找那个地点，我们建议你优先阅读此部分。

冒险引子 Adventure Hooks

有传闻称，这里可以藏有处刑魔机手下的无数受害者所留下的大量宝藏和魔法物品。许多冒险者都犯下了他们生命中最后一个致命的错误，那就是仅仅因为这个原因去接近戮石广场。不过你的角色们也可能只是偶然或者愚蠢地逛到了这个遗弃之地。另外，一些胆大的角色可能穿过广场前往蓄水池，也可能是通过黑象牙旅店的走私者通道来到这里的。

致命威胁

无论他们因为什么理由来到这里，你的角色们都应该选择逃跑。处刑魔机不是需要击败的敌人，而是需要避开的障碍（或者说，如果有机会引诱毫无防备的敌人来到这里，处刑魔机也可能有自己的价值！）。它的存在提醒着人们，德拉肯海姆存在着冷酷无情、无法控制的危险。你的角色们可以用巧妙的手法逃离或绕开这一威胁，但如果你的玩家直接与处刑魔机开战，千万不要手软。他们犯下了一个极其愚蠢的错误，就是胆敢去挑战一个精心设计的死亡陷阱，因此他们应该受到应得的惩罚。

区域详述 Area Details

戮石广场 Slaughterstone Square

戮石广场是一个八角形的巨大广场，广场上铺着宽大的石板，中央有一个 30 尺宽，5 尺高的花岗岩碗状喷泉。广场周围密集的联排别墅有三层高，陡峭的屋顶上饰有锻铁的脊饰。许多房屋正面的狭窄阳台和高耸窗户俯视着这个广场。 这里的建筑结构就像是一幅幅严厉的面孔，无声地审判着周围的一切，就仿佛所有仰视它们的人都是不合格的。已经凝固的血痕染红了街道，周围有几具残缺不全的尸体。

  • @UUID[Actor.4UrBZVZ2pkfwy8h3]（附录 A） 屹立于喷泉旁一动不动，手上的斧头沾满了鲜血。
  • 它会突然活化，并立刻冲向任何发起攻击、施放法术或是靠近他周围 120 尺范围内的生物。它会无差别地发起攻击，只有当它继续受到来自广场之外的攻击时，他才会追击广场外的生物。
  • 处刑魔机有个奇怪的习惯，那就是收集被害者的尸体，然后将他们的遗骸丢进喷泉。鲜血和尸块在喷泉内四处飞溅，然后沉入蓄水池。
  • 喷泉收集到的雨水会以螺旋状排入其中央的一个直径 5 尺的洞中。这个孔直接通往地下的蓄水池，水流会流入这里填满这座水库。洞口原本有一个锻铁栅栏，但现在只剩下几块突出的尖锐铁片。
  • 在处刑魔机还未丢入广场的几具尸体中，可以找到一些损坏的冒险装备和武器。如果你愿意，还可以让冒险者在这里找到 [[/r 1d6]] 瓶非普通魔法药水以及 1 件非普通魔法物品。
  • 喷泉旁有一个沉重的下水道井盖，可以以一个动作、适当的杠杆工具以及一个 DC 20 的力量检定来将其从这头抬起来。它通向一条通往旧城蓄水池的楼梯。

治安法庭 Magistrate's Court

戮石广场上最大的建筑是一座外观阴沉而庄严的庄园，它有三层高，面积占据了整个街区。每层楼的尖形窗户上都带着碎掉的玻璃。宽阔的石阶通向一个有着双开大门的入口，入口上方悬挂着印有城市徽章的横幅。

  • 这座建筑既是法院，也是市长与议会议员等文职官员的办公室。许多公共记录都被存放于此处的档案馆内，因此，想要搜索有关德拉肯海姆居民信息的人可以在这里找到这些文件。

“在计划前往戮石广场时，一定要记住：你不一定需要跑赢处刑魔机， 你只需要跑赢你最慢的队友……”

—— 维奥·斯耶纳

Battle of Temple Gate.name: 圣殿门之战
Battle of Temple Gate.text:
圣殿门之战

在战役的关键时刻，白银骑士团会宣布他们打算攻占圣殿门的计划，这将迫使加米尔犬怪撤回城市内，并为他们的部队在城市立足奠定基石。无论角色效忠于哪个派系，这场战役都将成为影响所有派系的重大事件，这场战斗揭开了后续一系列事件的序幕，并最终导向圣维特鲁维奥大教堂内的对峙。

圣殿门之战会在玩家角色们完成以下事件后发生：

  • 会见派系领袖并与其中一位或多位组建同盟关系。
  • 探索寰宇钟塔并从那里找回德拉肯海姆信物 Seal of Drakkenheim ，同时至少探索过内城的至少两处其他地点。

随着故事的发展, @UUID[Actor.q4jRqiq5PgWcqvxD] 会认为现在是时候向圣殿门发起攻势了。根据角色们与哪个派系的关系最亲密，后续的故事结果也会有所不同。与角色们之间关系最密切的派系将为他们提供以下信息：

白银骑士团 Silver Order. 如果玩家角色们与白银骑士团结盟，希奥多·马歇尔会将角色们召集到黎明营地一同制定战斗计划。他会建议角色们打头阵，为骑兵部队打开大门，而白银骑士团的部队会拦住其他的 @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0] 增援部队。白银骑士团意在夺取城门，但希望在战斗中避免伤害或破坏城门，以便在后续将其用作他们的前沿基地。不过，他担心其他派系会在行动过程中掺和一脚，因此他请求角色们充当特使，去寻求覆影明灯的协助，或者与其他派系取得联系，以确保他们不会进行干涉。

覆影明灯 Hooded Lanterns. 覆影明灯曾多次试图击退加米尔部队, 但事实证明 @UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS] 是个可怕的对手。 @UUID[Actor.L0yjx19PnmJgrqVk] 愿意同白银骑士团开展联合行动，并提议让在内城行动的覆影明灯和在正面进攻的白银骑士团一同发起夹击。然而，总司令对让这个外国军队在德拉肯海姆站稳脚跟一事感到担忧，他希望白银骑士团能保证他们不是来侵略这座城市的。

女王的弟兄们 Queen's Men. 加米尔部队对女王的弟兄们来说也是个麻烦，它们已经对她手下的帮派成员们造成了过多的伤亡, 盗贼女王确实想要见到白银骑士团达成他们的目标，不过她对此事别有居心。她认为，一旦白银骑士团招致 @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] 的愤怒，那么守备圣殿门的骑士团兵力将会被削减到极限，她渴望看到此役的胜利会让白银骑士团减员，而导致其最终的惨败。

紫晶学院 Amethyst Academy. @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] 对白银骑士团的计划既好奇又担忧，他想知道他们打算做什么。他了解白银骑士团致力于摧毁妄质，而这对学院来说就是个问题了。但是，他怀疑到底有没有可能摧毁掉城中所有的妄质，因此他想知道白银骑士团是不是藏着什么底牌。攻占圣殿门并剿灭其中的怪物对所有人来说都是一件益事，但学院不希望白银骑士团在城里过得太舒坦。

天火信众 Followers of the Falling Fire. @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 对白银骑士团的计划感到担忧，她不希望骑士团在距离他们如此之近的地方站稳脚跟。她预感到白银骑士团会利用这股势头对天火教发动战争，然后把他们赶出城市，就好像他们不是什么比加米尔族怪物好上多少的东西。

“许多冒险者自以为能从城墙上面轻松通过……好笑的是我从来没见过他们走那条路线回来……也许他们根本就没能回来。”

— 维奥·斯耶纳

卢克雷蒂亚希望设法阻止白银骑士团夺取城门，她想让角色们直接把 @UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS] 引出大教堂，让它与白银骑士团正面作战。这样他们就可以趁机夺取大教堂，同时还能削弱两方敌人的势力。

城门之战 War At The Gate

所有阵营的角色都可以自愿参加圣殿门前的战役。白银骑士团会派遣狮鹫骑手、骑兵和一队骑士以各种方式为角色们提供援助。玩家们可以通过各种具有创造性的方式攻占圣殿门。但无论如何，这将是一场恶战。

如果玩家角色在这个时候已经是白银骑士团的敌人了，他们也可以选择去说服其他派系来横插一脚，让白银骑士团在战斗中败北。玩家们有很多办法可以左右战局并让其向着自己期望的方向发展。

大门前的守备力量包括 100 只 @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0] 还有它们的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kr6r8bhSehACPfZ8]。他们在城墙上安置有手持弩箭的哨兵，两侧的塔楼上也始终驻守着几只加米尔犬怪。他们关上了大门的吊闸，所有的门和房间都戒备森严。即使战斗正在白热化，角色们也必须在加米尔守军之间杀出一条路才能打开吊闸，并确保白银骑士团能攻下大门。

  • 玩家的任务是为白银骑士团打开城门。
  • 他们提议用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_classpack.monsterspack.Actor.h052EIIUmRwJum65] 把角色们送进城门内，或者在第一次冲锋时把他们放在马背上，并带他们尽可能地靠近城门。
  • 两座塔楼内各有一个绞盘，它们必须全部打开才能升起大门。玩家们必须同时开启这两个绞盘。
  • 一旦大门开启，白银骑士团就可以在 ([[/r 1d6]]) 轮内将加米尔守军驱逐干净，他们的部队会涌入门楼，清除掉一切没有立刻逃走的怪物。

发展 Developments

在圣殿门一役后，众派系接下来的情况可能会朝着几个方向发展。

如果白银骑士团成功

只要城门被攻陷，白银骑士团就能占据它，但是如果没有角色们的协助，他们就没法继续推进并深入城市。他们将大门作为一个前哨指挥所，而他们的动作也开始让其他派系的关注起他们的目的和目标。白银骑士团的下一步棋将是尝试说服角色们帮助他们击败 @UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS] 并夺取大教堂。

@UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 想要在白银骑士团之前前往大教堂，并在角色们和他们结盟的情况下，把这件事交给角色们完成。与此同时， @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] 则希望角色们占领大教堂，并把里面一切她可能看得上的东西搜刮回来带给她。根据角色们与派系间的关系，角色们可以尝试向覆影明灯或紫晶学院解释白银骑士团的行动的价值，以说服他们继续帮助白银骑士团。

如果白银骑士团失败

这场战役可能不如预期般顺利，亦或者角色们并不支持白银骑士团的目标。总之，如果白银骑士团没能占领城门，饕餮之主就会获得战役的胜利，他会把白银骑士团骑士惨不忍睹的尸首吊在城门前示众。白银骑士团仍会驻守在黎明营地，但如果没有角色们的帮助，他们将无法在城内落足。如果他们孤立无援，白银骑士团就会向伊利瑞亚请求增援以帮助他们通过武力夺取城市，同时他们会开始筹划下一场需要耗时数月来准备的突袭行动。

  • 如果角色们已经进入内城探索，白银骑士团就会向他们说明自己想要攻下圣殿门的计划。
  • 如果角色们对这场战役不予干涉，白银骑士团能否成功夺取圣殿门将取决于你——我们建议将局面变得对玩家来说尽可能的复杂。
  • 除非角色们进行干涉，否则覆影明灯会和白银骑士团联手夺取圣殿门，但是由于没有同角色们协作，他们的联盟很快就会解散，这让白银骑士团即使已经夺取大门，也无法继续向城内推进。
    • \
  • 如果角色们还没有和覆影明灯或白银骑士团之间有过联系，但已经探索过内城，那就让覆影明灯或白银骑士团的人询问角色们是否愿意帮助他们组建一个联盟以攻取城门。至于这是否可行就交予角色们斟酌。

Cosmological Clocktower.name: 寰宇钟塔
Cosmological Clocktower.text:
寰宇钟塔

寰宇钟塔建于德拉肯海姆中心区域的集市广场之上。这座机械结构的建筑奇迹是在一位古怪君主的授意下建造的，但在 111 年前，它神秘地停止了运作，而其公共钟塔的职能也被圣维特鲁维奥大教堂所取代。许多进入废墟的早期探险队都将寰宇钟塔当做一处地标或者扎营地，因为钟楼的阁楼恰好显眼地高出污霭。然而，德拉肯海姆最高的塔楼也没有比下面的街道安全多少，尤其是还有一群嗜血的鸟妖栖息在塔上。

总览

在这场冒险中，冒险者会突击进入寰宇钟塔以夺得这个战略前哨。他们不仅会因此在城内获得一处行动基地，他们还会在这里找到一件德拉肯海姆信物。

冒险引子

适时休整： 根据一个流传已久的传闻的说法，寰宇钟塔是德拉肯海姆之内为数不多的“安全”的休息场所。这些传闻确实是真的：钟塔的阁楼正好高出污霭，因此这里是角色长休的安全地点。每个派系的首领都知道钟塔在城内作为行动基地的价值。一旦角色们和任何派系首领建立起了积极的合作关系，他们就会建议角色们从居住于那里的鸟妖手中夺回钟塔。

互动

目前尚不清楚这些鸟妖是否是鸟类或者人类在经历怪异的变异后的结果，亦或是两者兼有。但这些反复无常、残忍且极具领地意识的怪物对讨价还价或谈判毫无兴趣。塔里住着将近 40 只鸟妖 harpy，不过在任何时候，都有半数的鸟妖在外狩猎。领导它们的是@UUID[Actor.PiuU7fM0cJ07APjq]{猩红女伯爵 Crimson Countess}，一只红翎妖鸟女族长:

  • 个性特点：我会发出令人毛骨悚然的战吼并在空中飞舞以示威吓。
  • 理想： 在地上走的生物都是翱翔天际者的猎物。
  • 牵绊：我从杀戮中收集战利品，以此提醒我的族人谁才是老大。
  • 缺陷：我有强烈的领地意识，我的对手在嫉妒我，他们还在觊觎我的宝藏。

“总有鸟群一直绕着钟塔打转，但最近它们好像变得越来越大了”

— 塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

区域详述

集市广场

集市广场是城市里最大的开放式庭院。这个广场由两个小广场组成，中间则由一连串的银行、金库、公会和商会机构分隔开来。广场周围环绕着高大的房屋及店铺的废墟与遗迹。在广场上散落着德拉肯海姆中央露天市场的残存物：一排排摊位、帆布帐篷、临时大篷、篮子、板条箱、马车、木桶、手推车、货车车箱还有白骨，这一切绘制出了这里昔日混乱破败的景象。空中传来摇篮曲、风铃声还有悠远的钟声。

集市广场记录着许多战斗残留下来的伤痕：临时路障、烧焦的痕迹、破碎的武器、残破的盔甲还有一些散落的尸体。鼠群四窜，乌鸦食腐，空气中弥漫着银紫色的薄雾。向上望去，你可以看到穿透迷雾的寰宇钟塔。

  • 在集市广场逗留是一件危险的事情。没有采取任何隐蔽措施的角色们都会被塔上飞出的 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) 只 @UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.nVuPSYXEy7yNqfFD]{鸟妖} 发现并受到攻击。

德拉肯海姆公会大厅： 这座建筑距离钟塔不远。这座占地较广的开放式大厅曾是德拉肯海姆的贸易与工业管理中心，也是城市各公会领袖和商人的聚集地，内设有办公室、金库和一个曾作公会议事厅用的大礼堂。但是，这个辉煌一时的建筑的拱顶已经完全坍塌，只留下了这座建筑的残破外墙。也许还有一些庞大的金库被掩埋在残垣断壁之下，但是要挖掘出这些被损坏的建筑部分则要花费极大的功夫。

钟塔外墙

在广场的中央就是钟塔。这座 300 尺高的方形钟塔底座有 50 尺宽，塔的四角有数座呈圆柱形的角楼，塔壁则由扶壁支撑。塔的正面可谓是一座建筑奇观。而靠近塔顶的位置则有一个 30 尺宽的巨大玻璃钟面，钟面上的数字和指针辅以银质、黄铜和纯金的细丝装饰。塔顶是一个陡峭的尖顶，在顶端有一个锻铁风向标。

中央时钟的边框是由压花金属和玻璃钟面构成的，上面描绘着每个月太阳的运行轨迹和月相。表盘还以独特的艺术风格展示着当前的季节和星座，因此人们不仅可以确认时间，还可以确认当前的日期。从钟面向下延伸则是一个由圆形玻璃板、齿轮和滑轮组组成的机械系统，它通过精准的机械构造展示了行星与恒星在星界飞驰时的雄伟舞姿。叠加在行星上的多色玻璃镜片描绘着来世和次位面的超自然运行轨迹以及他们与尘世间的联系。塔身的其他部分饰有优雅的雕像，描绘着天使、圣徒、恶魔、魔鬼、元素还有其他各种异界的生物。有些楼层还有一排哥特式的窗户，三叶草拱形的窗框上嵌满了彩色马赛克玻璃。

整个机械装置都早已停转，它停在了 111 年前的第 11 个月的第11 日，上午 11 时 11 分，位面的位相则停留在元素混沌和幻梦境之间。

在一层，一道石质阶梯通往了一扇铜制的双开门。

钟塔内部

钟塔内部和其优雅的外部装饰形成了鲜明对比。这里的墙壁由裸露的砖块砌成，一条摇摇晃晃、被铁制脚手架支撑着的木质楼梯向上通往塔的内部。起装饰作用的外窗勉强能透进一些光线，但沿途的许多窗户都已破损严重。石质地板上满是灰尘、骨头、碎片和鸟类的粪便。用链条连接的齿轮、滑轮上悬挂着的成堆的沉重配重块以及钟摆装置就挂在北面的墙上。向高处望去可看到一口大钟。

楼梯： 这些嘎吱作响的木质楼梯沿着钟塔的内墙蜿蜒近200 尺，它连接着底层和上方的钟楼门架。每段楼梯都会陡峭地上升20 尺，然后抵达拐角处的设有细长金属栏杆的小平台。

  • 鸟妖们将巢筑在楼梯间的平台上。它们会从破碎的窗口进出钟塔，从不使用前门。不论何时，这里都可能有多达 ([[/r 3d6]]) 只@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.nVuPSYXEy7yNqfFD]{鸟妖} 栖息在楼梯上。/li>

钟楼： 楼梯的尽头是一块依塔楼外墙架设的木质门架。在这条狭窄的通道上可以直接俯瞰悬挂在钟楼中央的十三口巨大铜钟。每口铜钟宽 3 至 5 尺，重达数吨。铜钟与金属横梁相连，不会摆动。因此，钟是由安装在每口钟上的锤子通过上方的机器控制进行敲击而作响的。由于每口钟都会发出不同的音调，当钟楼仍在运作时，这个机械系统就可以演奏出许多独特的钟乐。

  • 这里高度 200 尺。在西北侧的栏杆上有一个螺旋形的楼梯可以通向其上方 20 尺高处的钟表装置内。
  • @UUID[Actor.PiuU7fM0cJ07APjq] 驯养的 [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmManticore00000]{蝎尾狮} 在钟楼的壁龛里筑了巢。

钟表装置

这个房间内满是由齿轮、配重块和钟表结构所组成的复杂系统装置。通过几扇薄薄的窗户可以俯瞰周围的城市景观。这里的地板上有几个金属孔盖和木质活板门，可以通向下面的机械结构和大钟所在的位置。在主钟摆的位置放置有一块奇怪的花岗岩方尖碑，它是用以控制时钟“嘀嗒”的核心装置。在花岗岩上有三个被凿出来的空槽，槽上雕有精致的镀铜花纹。其周围的花岗岩表面还刻有镶嵌了金银材质细线的精美的精灵语符文。几枚硬币被精准且平稳地摆在方尖碑上面。一个由滑轮、绞盘和杠杆组成的机械系统将这块方尖碑和其他的钟表结构相连接。

这里的一组架子上摆放着几张表面凹凸不平的金属圆盘，每张圆盘都被放在一个印有一个歌曲名的纸质文件夹内。当钟楼运作时，就可以通过将这些碟片塞入装置内来决定要播放哪首歌曲。

几个小巧且少见的自动机器人无精打采地在这个小房间里徘徊着，检查并修补着机械的部件。它们形似柏拉图多面体*，长着细长 的机械四肢、逼真到令人不安的玻璃眼珠和机械口器。

*译注 ：疑似官方为规避版权而对魔冢的称呼*

  • 这里有 [[/r 1d6]] 个自动机器人。如果需要使用他们的数据，使用@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.mX02QyG9iUQB2MVH]{活化盔甲} 的数据，但它们的体型为小型。如果尝试和它们进行交流，它们会显得茫然且混乱。当它们说话时，它们会重复且啰嗦地说出一大串由“0”和“1”两个字组成的句子。一个较大的自动机器人残骸散落在房间内，看起来像是从内部炸开了。
  • 精灵语符文精确且详细地论述了涉及时间流逝、行星、季节和位面相关的数学计算步骤。
  • 大理石本身其实很轻，具有奥秘熟练项或具有工程学相关领域背景的角色可以推断出，这样一块石头无法精确地驱动如此复杂的时钟装置。
  • 使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{侦测魔法} 或 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{鉴定术} 检查大理石可以发现它是一件魔法物品。它与时间和空间本身进行了同调，可以改变自身的密度和构成，从而成为一个完美的钟摆。然而，它缺少一个合适的动力源。

T鸟妖们很少来到这层。他们不会使用楼梯，因此会直接飞往筑巢处或者从钟楼的破窗户飞进飞出。

筑巢处

这里有一股混合了鸟巢和女人闺房气息的恶心气味。这里摆放着骨骼、骷髅头还有其他人体器官之类的骇人装饰品，还有一些从废墟中捡来的饰物：例如枕头、床单、纱布等。所有这些东西都十分肮脏、破烂且被损坏了。阳台上悬挂着几个装有几具囚犯尸体的牢笼。

  • 这里是 @UUID[Actor.PiuU7fM0cJ07APjq]的巢穴。
  • 宝藏： 猩红女伯爵积攒着许多饰品和战利品，其中的大多数都是骷髅头和骨头。她持有一把@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgJavelinOfLigh]{闪电标枪}，而她最爱的饰物是其中一件德拉肯海姆信物：@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.SteT000000000021]。它位于她的巢里，边上还有一张纸条：

我的孩子——拿上这件宝物然后赶紧逃跑吧。把它藏到城堡外的安全之处，然后赶快逃出城市。不论发生什么，不要忘了我永远深爱着你。——爸爸

塔尖阁楼

从前的守钟人的住所现已破败不堪，但似乎有冒险者曾在此扎营。

  • 这里留着 [[/r 1d6]] 瓶非普通药水和 1 瓶@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgKeoghtomsOint]{卡夫统灵药}。
  • 该区域位于污霭之上，角色们可以安全地在此长休。
  • 搜索书架和文件夹可以发现一封写给守钟人的信（见下文）。

发展

并非所有居住于钟塔内的鸟妖都会在角色们入侵时出现。清理完钟塔并打算将其作为自己的行动据点的角色们可能会在几周后面对来自前住户的反击，甚至是来自猩红女伯爵以前的敌人的袭击。

占领钟塔是战役的一个重要里程碑，而且其他派系都会对此成果感到嫉妒。敌对的派系可能会试图找到住在这里的角色，甚至直接抢夺钟塔的控制权。虽然角色们可以将这里作为一处可防守的休息处，但一旦其他派系得知此事，他们就可能会派遣突击队趁角色们不在时占领钟塔。角色们最好能和其他派系组成友好的同盟来确保他们据点的安全，因为如果任其荒废，其他怪物和派系就会很快抓住机会控制这个战略要地。不过，只要角色们采取了足够的措施来加固他们的新据点，这里就会成为他们在未来探索行动中的重要行动基地。

总管印章

如果有任何派系得知角色们找到了一件德拉肯海姆信物，这对他们来说就将是一个重大进展。找回这件遗失的物品会点燃覆影明灯对重振王国的希望，并会立刻吸引 @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] 的浓厚兴趣。任何派系的副官都可以一眼认出这件信物，如果他们看到角色们穿戴着它，他们就会邀请角色们和自己的派系领袖交谈，而后者会告诉他们这件信物的意义和蕴含的力量。

致守钟人的信

守钟人先生：

感谢您的来信。我已知晓您和您的家人世世代代都在为维持钟塔运作而辛勤劳作，尽管钟塔的主要装置在一个世纪前就已经失灵了。我必须承认，长久以来，我一直认为钟塔是一个愚蠢无聊的建筑，建造它所依据的宇宙学理论早就已经被推翻。但是，最近在栖云岛上的发现点燃了我的好奇心。

钟塔原本的机械零件的年龄可以追溯至远古时期，其中许多关键部件似乎与在栖云岛的几处古代精灵遗迹中发现的装置十分相似，但我无法判断出它们最初的用途。在检查钟塔的机械装置后，我发现有几个精密部件损坏严重，还缺失了一些部件，其中就包括动力源。我们相信在栖云岛找到的那些部件可以用于修复钟塔。

这些部件将于 9 月 13 日送达莫测之塔。请安排我们的法师和工匠从下周开始维修工作但遗憾的是，您和家人势必要在未来搬离这里。我们将准备安排紫晶学院租用这座钟塔。

谨致问候，

阿德里亚娜·莫蒂耶纳大法师，紫晶学院

  • 9 月 13 日正是陨星撞击德拉肯海姆事件发生的三天前。
  • 遗失的动力源事实上其实是一块早在陨星坠落前就存在于这颗星球上的妄质水晶。这样的情况极其罕见，但是确实客观存在。这些部件可以在莫测之塔的管理人办公室里找到。
  • 如果玩家们找回部件并修复了钟塔，那么会发生什么将取决于你。这可能会揭露一个关于陨星的秘密，或解锁一条关于某个角色个人任务的关键线索。

Chapter 8-Faction Strongholds.name: 派系的据点
Chapter 8-Faction Strongholds.text:
第 8 章：派系的据点

在德拉肯海姆冒险期间，角色们可能会以不同的方式探索五个强大派系的据点。在战役早期，他们可能会在这些地点和派系成员们建立友好关系。但当角色们抵达 9 级或更高级别后，他们可能会考虑闯入敌对派系据点执行敌对任务。

互动 Interaction

最常见的情况下，玩家角色拜访派系据点，和派系成员会面，与派系领袖面谈。与友好派系合作的角色可能会被邀请使用据点作为其行动基地。

渗透 Infiltration

角色们也可能出于特定目的试图潜入一个派系据点，比如营救一位囚犯、破坏其资源或防御监视体系、盗窃重要物品，甚至暗杀派系领袖。每个派系都预料了这种情况的发生，并采取了合理而明智的预防措施，能够为潜入的角色带来刺激的挑战。在战役中获得了关键物品如圣维特鲁维奥圣遗物或德拉肯海姆信物的派系会将其存放在安全的地点，通常由派系领袖亲自守卫，并设立额外的巡逻队，还可能要求派系的施法者使用防护系法术，如@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.oUURtReMn8pfKbzf]{守卫刻纹} 来保护其安全。

袭击 Assault

在战役的某个时点，玩家角色可能会领导对敌对据点的侵入，发动一场全面攻击，将敌对派系赶出德拉肯海姆。对这样一个激动人心的决战时刻，赌注应当适当地提高：据点进攻是一场你死我活的游戏。你应当让玩家角色有机会和盟友提前制订作战计划，并将各个派系的全部资源（和诡计）都摆上桌来。

然而，考虑到涉及的部队，除非采用具体并广泛使用的方式来掩盖，否则大多数派系召集队伍全力进攻另一个派系据点根本无法暗中进行。这给了被进攻的派系准备防御和采取足够预防措施的时间，因此你应当增加在场的 NPC 数量，在关键地点部署派系突击队，并保护派系领袖的房间和各个据点的主要入口。

在全面进攻期间，最好让玩家角色面对精英派系突击队、带头进攻正门、领导突击队袭击以破坏重要防御工事，或者与派系副官或派系领袖进行戏剧性的决战，而他们的派系盟友则与其他普通敌人交战以阻止敌人的增援。任何派系据点的重点都应当放在英雄们的行动上，而非繁琐的大规模战斗场景（除非你的玩家们真的很喜欢这样）。

冒险 Adventure

莫测之塔和盗贼王廷是两个明显的例外：它们都更类似一处典型的冒险地点，能够进行相应的探索。

Inscrutable Tower.name: Inscrutable Tower
Inscrutable Tower.text:
Inscrutable Tower

Alongside the distant Paradox Castle and the Enigma Ziggurat, the Inscrutable Tower is one of three widely known strongholds of the Amethyst Academy. Though there are five more hidden throughout the world, this is unquestionably the greatest of them all. The loss of the tower was a nearly crippling blow for the otherwise mighty and resourceful Academy, though the Directorate has taken great pains to conceal this uncomfortable fact.

This enigmatic structure was a mystery even before a meteor struck it. None can say exactly when it appeared in Drakkenheim, but most think that it must have been some time after the Edicts of Lumen. Yet there is no record of its construction, which seems incongruent given the massive tower would have taken decades to build.

In truth, the Inscrutable Tower is the ancient and legendary hidden fortress of the Sorcerer Kings. This extraplanar dungeon was built within the roiling realm of chaotic possibility known as the Space Between Worlds in far antiquity by powerful and insane sorcerers to hide away their magical knowledge, but was left forgotten and abandoned for a thousand years. When the mages of the Amethyst Academy located it several hundred years ago, they tapped into the immense power of its Arcane Nexus to shift the whole structure into the mortal world, where it now stands in Drakkenheim. Since then, the Amethyst Academy gradually expunged most records and memories of this accomplishment to rehabilitate the tower's evil and ominous history. Yet there are many secrets about this place unknown to even the Amethyst Academy, including whatever magical forces now hold the tower together even after a meteor smashed through it.

Overview

Unlike the other faction strongholds described herein, the Inscrutable Tower is not occupied by its controlling faction. Instead, the Amethyst Academy aims to regain control of it. Though it will take them months, if not years, to refurbish and repair the tower once this is done, it could cement the Academy's controlling influence over Drakkenheim.

Adventure Hooks

Seize the Tower. Securing control of the Inscrutable Tower is a make-or-break mission for the Amethyst Academy, but also its enemies. If the Academy is able to regain control over the tower and begin repairs, it will allow them to enact more ambitious actions to seize control of Drakkenheim. On the other hand, the Amethyst Academy can be organizationally paralyzed if another faction occupies the tower and takes the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017].

Interactions

Interloper

Several malfeasant mages are found throughout Drakkenheim: @UUID[Actor.jfJGagVOoUgyCyxn], the @UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG], and @UUID[Actor.8mw3Q1D3NIIXIlSg]. If any of them have survived to this point in the campaign, choose one of them to make their own incursion into the Inscrutable Tower to seize it for themselves (you might want to have Oscar Yoren “level up” to an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.B7lBOr1AahNZs4a6]). They gather up some appropriate minions of their own: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wights}, @UUID[Actor.sHgFXfdwxl0mefuB]{Haze Hulks}, or summoned elementals (respectively) and are encountered at the breach in the library, plumbing the arcane knowledge within. The malfeasant has managed to claim the Inscrutable Staff for themselves, and are searching for an alternate means to control the Nexus as they cannot do so alone.

Alternatively, if the players have made an enemy of the Amethyst Academy, @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] sends his @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jccbeBIfLrqEZnDP] here instead under similar circumstances. If his simulacrum was already destroyed, he arrives in person with an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.h98AuPfomEPcCibP] and an Amethyst Academy strike team.

Finally, if neither seems like a viable option, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LTomFUTBrkRi0Pj5] has managed to escape the Deep Cells and conjured several @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8SMQl75HLjhuSeau]{Fire Elementals} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.IiEDPMWqBlzkggYD]{Azers} to serve it. The creature hasn't fully escaped the binding magic holding it to the Inscrutable Tower, and is looking through the books for another means of escape.

Random Encounters ([[/r 1d6]])

Check for random encounters each time characters enter rooms in the Inscrutable Tower:

1 Unfortunate Apprentices. @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium dregs}. Each can cast two wizard cantrips at-will.
2 Restless Furniture. Animated armour, flying swords, and rug of smothering
3 Residual Magic. 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Will-o-wisps
4 Disembodied Mages. 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) @UUID[Actor.lAt2j5PaTnH71T5O]{Arcane Wraiths}
5 Elements Unbound. 1d6 elementals of any kind (fire, air, water, or earth)
6 Malfunctioning Protectors. 1d4 malfunctioning @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE]{Shield Guardians}. There's a 50% chance each still is storing a spell within.

Area Details

Three-quarters of the Inscrutable Tower is composed of a massive library (detailed below) that spans most levels. The remaining floors in this unfathomably large structure have a sprawling maze-like layout with roughly a dozen rooms connected by a twisting set of corridors. There is no consistency in the floorplan from floor to floor, and the configuration of the rooms is often illogical and may even defy the spatial geometry. Dormitories might be beside highly dangerous laboratories, or storage rooms for ingredients used by a workshop kept several floors apart. You can construct layouts as you see fit by using the various rooms described in the Residence Floors and Research Floors.

The Lobby, Great Hall, Library, Director's Office, Nexus, and Deep Cells are singular specific locations in the tower, however.

Exotic Materials. The walls, halls, and furnishings found in the Inscrutable Tower are made from obsidian, dark steel, granite, black marble, and glass.

Magical Amenities. Magic provides lush comforts throughout the Inscrutable Tower. Fireplace hearths don't have chimneys, instead using special @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MK6gpQMeDFo0cP9f] spells that radiate pleasant but otherwise harmless heat. Most rooms are illuminated with persistent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CAxSzHWizrafT033]. Bound @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{Unseen Servants} tend the halls, keeping rooms tidy. Magical fonts produce water via the create water spell. A creature can focus their attention (as an action) on a light source, heat source, or water source they can see to cause it to turn on or off, or adjust its brightness or intensity. The parameters are such that these can't become so hot or cold to harm a creature, or so bright as to blind them. However, each time these are manipulated, roll 1d20. On a 1, a random @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{Arcane Anomaly} is triggered due to the erratic magic that grips the tower.

Magical Wards. Powerful magic protects the Inscrutable Tower. The exterior walls and doors are magically reinforced and are immune to all damage (except meteors). The doors and walls extend into the ethereal plane, blocking ethereal travel through them, and magic can't alter their forms. Creatures outside the tower can't teleport inside, nor can they teleport within the tower rooms unless they have a direct line of sight to their destination.

Tower Exterior

The Inscrutable Tower of the Amethyst Academy is an immensely tall structure that reaches a dizzying height of twelve hundred feet. The shimmering obsidian walls are perfectly smooth; there is not a single window or embellishment along its outer face save a deep vertical groove cut into the pinnacle. Seen at a distance the tower appears relatively narrow, though it is roughly one hundred and fifty feet wide and anchored by sharply arched buttresses at the base. The tower has been smashed apart roughly two-thirds up its height. Remarkably, the top of the tower hovers above in utter defiance of gravity. Between the upper and lower sections is a gaping breach with pieces of floating debris locked in the air; frozen in time at the moment a meteor soared through it. A keen-eyed observer can see fragments of delerium, broken bookshelves, and scattered tomes bobbing about the wreckage.

Academy Plaza

The cobblestone streets break here, a campus park surrounding the Inscrutable Tower. A forest of delerium crystals have grown up around the tower that surrounds a small artificial lake. Overlooking the pond is a large stone plinth surrounded by arcane arches.

The area around the Inscrutable Tower is covered by the Deep Haze.

  • Etched into the stone is a great @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8aWtP5hcrmcEesBW].
  • The remains of a pair of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z3gSIXHHWYaHjfBT]{Stone Golems} who once guarded this site.
  • 1d4 @UUID[Actor.BezicP0b3wmU2u4p]{Protean Abominations} and 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8pX2JhWUpTNNRBVx]{Gibbering Mouthers} inhabit the plaza.

Tower Entrance

A broad staircase of seventeen steps bordered by a sloping ramp leads up to the singular entrance of the Inscrutable Tower. The dark steel doors are engraved with the sigil of the Amethyst Academy: a lidless arcane eye set within an octagram. There are no handles or hinges upon the door.

  • A character attuned to a set of academy rings who places their hands upon the door causes a set of glowing arcane runes to appear. After a short set of arcane clicks and whirring noises, there is a flash of light and the doors slide open with a screech.
  • Since academy rings are made for a specific individual, if the player characters don't possess a set of their own, they will need either an ally or a living prisoner wearing them to gain entry into the Inscrutable Tower. Characters can also enter via the breach itself, assuming they can fly or climb there.

Lobby

The front doors lead into a massive lobby that fills the tower base. The ceiling is nearly fifty feet high and supported by obsidian pillars etched with intricate sigils, and the floor is reflective marble decorated with intricate arcane patterns. Rows of tall, thin vents along the outer walls form transparent openings allowing a view of Drakkenheim outside. On two opposite sides of the lobby are three sets of metallic double doors, and railingless spiral staircases of metal and glass wrap upward around the pillars on each corner.

Throughout the rest of the room are chest-high stone dividing walls that form semi-private meeting areas set with metallic chairs and glass-topped tables. Bobbling motes of spectral lights drift through the air, illuminating the chamber with soft arcane light.

  • Four erratic @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE]{Shield Guardians} linger in this chamber and attack any who enter. Two hold spells: one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X3DrXgxjwI2dvkD6], the other @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WN2LWEljYU6QqnRH], and both are as if cast by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mQnsXanewsPiV7QE].

Elevators

Four of the six sets of metal double doors are closed, one has slid partially ajar. The last is erratically slamming shut and jolting open at random. Looking beyond is a ten-foot-wide shaft that bristles and hums with arcane energy. Once in a while there is a thunderous crack of lightning that resounds up and down the shaft.

  • The shafts extend up the length of the tower, but are broken by the breach. Four of these elevators still function, however, and can provide access to the lower portion of the tower.
  • Once every 1d6 rounds a lighting bolt (DC 16) shoots up the length of the two broken shafts.
  • The closed doors magically open when any creature approaches within ten feet of them, and a prismatic platform of magical energy forms within the shaft, above which float glimmering arcane runes arranged vertically: from bottom to top, the runes read “Lobby”, “Great Hall”, “Residences”, “Research Levels”, “Library”, and “Director's Office”.
  • A creature may step onto the platform and speak where it wishes to go, and the platform ascends with stomach-churning speed to that level.
  • There are multiple runes for the residences, research levels, and library indicating the dozens of levels for each, thus the speaker must specify individual floors. The levels past “63” don't function, so travel via the elevators to the upper portions of the library, the director's office, or the nexus isn't possible.

Great Hall

This resplendent dining hall prominently features an elevated platform where a long marble-topped dinner table with high chairs faces the room. Before it are three long rows of polished granite-topped tables with dark steel chairs. Spectral chandeliers and candles of magical energy hover above, illuminating the room. Along the walls are tall portraits of archmages and professors of the Amethyst Academy.

  • The portraits are magical, and the figures within come to life and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy] anyone who casts a spell in this room.
  • The sleek dinnerware are all magically animated, and trundle into their place at the dinner tables with food from the kitchen, then whisk away to the scullery to clean themselves.
  • The large kitchen is immaculately clean and organized, featuring well-made iron ovens, stoves, steel-topped food preparation tables, and organized glass cabinets for the dinnerware and utensils. The cookware is similarly animated, preparing food and tending the kitchen on its own.
  • The well-stocked larder opens into a vast featureless extradimensional space containing prodigious food stores upon neatly organized metal shelves, all magically preserved. The kitchen cookware daintily retrieves ingredients as needed.

Residence Floors

Throughout the Inscrutable Tower are numerous apartments and quarters for the mages:

Apprentices' Dormitory. These rooms contain four single bunks set with personal chests and nightstands. There is a shelf over each bed for personal journals with an iron lantern hanging from it. Clusters of these rooms are often found around a small common room with a tiled hearth, glass-topped table, and shelved books on mundane topics.

Wizard's Apartments. These well-appointed apartments are sealed with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP] spells. Most often, entry is keyed to the original (long dead) occupant only. Each consists of several rooms:

  • A common room to hold meetings and take meals.
  • A workroom, summoning chamber, mediation room, or scrying pool.
  • A small study and private library to conduct personal research.
  • A private bedroom and water closet.

A permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv] tends each apartment, keeping it clean and tidy. Left behind in some apartments are spellbooks containing 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) wizard spells of 5th level or lower, plus 1d4 uncommon spell scrolls or potions.

Research Floor

Other floors of the Inscrutable Tower are dedicated to the study of magic and the manufacture of magical items:

Alchemy Labs. These chambers reek of chemicals, and contain cauldrons for creating potions or brewing alchemical concoctions. Cupboards and shelves contain material components for transmutation spells.

Arcane Workshops. These rooms are used to craft magic items.

  • Golem Workshop. Making golems. Partially complete golem.
  • Scriptorium. Scribing scrolls.
  • Surgeon's Chamber. Not common, but there is one such room in this tower to provide biological and necromantic research.
  • Spellforge. A pedestal before a “firing range.” “Target dummies.”
  • Elemental Forge. Fabrication Chamber.

Chamber of Illusions. These square rooms have scalar lines in a one-foot grid along the ceilings and walls. The otherwise entirely featureless void is the perfect place to practice illusion magic.

Copy Room. These rooms each contain 1d6 bound imps chained to writing desks. These miserable creatures are tasked with making copies of any book or writing given to them.

Materials Storage. Secure chambers sealed with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7p9IuWrSWFgfyQo2] spells. Spell components, inks, herbs, gemstones and other rare arcane ingredients, mundane materials such as stones, metals, leather, wood, cloth, parchment, and paper.

  • Morgue. Bodies used for biological and necromantic research.
  • Menagerie. Contains animals.

Seminar Rooms. Used for classes.

  • A handful of larger lecture halls are twice the size, suitable for groups of forty to fifty. Larger gatherings are held in the Assembly Hall, however.

Summoning Chamber. Specially prepared with materials needed for summoning and binding extraplanar creatures. Some have @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.y8A4HfTwd93ypdEz]{Magic Circles} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.wGKykLRS8UqChNXI].

  • One of the summoning chambers contains a woman sitting in the middle of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.y8A4HfTwd93ypdEz]. The circle is lined with salt. She begs players to break the salt barrier so she can leave. She argues that evil mages trapped her here and she has been stuck for years. She will plead with the players and offer them aid, information, wealth, or anything they want to hear. If the seal is broken she instantly transforms into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.AnseLn7HwuP97grf], and attempts to kill the party and flee.

Scrying Pools. These private and secure round meditation chambers contain a mirror, pool of water, or other font needed for divination spells.

Library

The Library of the Inscrutable Tower is a vast and dizzying place. Staircases zig-zag from wall to wall, weaving up the height of the tower between walkways of black marble with railings of dark steel and massive floating bookshelves of speckled granite and glass lined up like airborne dominoes. The stairs and shelves rumble lowly as they shift positions to converge at suspended balconies and galleries where obsidian-topped tables, plush couches, and amber spheres of glowing light are arranged into reading nooks and studying desks. Throughout, many stairs and platforms are nauseatingly oriented sideways, some even completely upside-down and backwards.

Every conceivable surface stores books. The balconies, furniture, walls, and even the steps of each stair all have cavities, niches, and shelves containing tomes of varying shapes, sizes, materials, and colours, some in neat and tightly organized rows, others in disheveled piles and scattered masses of pages.

  • The library comprises an ever-changing and dynamic layout. It is one hundred and fifty feet wide on each side.
  • The elevators stop at the ground level of the library and rise no higher. Before the damage was done, secret doors behind bookshelves along the walls opened for easier access, but these are broken now.

Stairs. Most staircases are thirty to fifty foot long sections, each five feet wide. The stairs connect and disconnect to each other and the platforms by some unfathomable pattern. For any given stair section, roll 1d20 each round, and on a 1, it moves.

Platforms. The various platforms have a variety of equilateral shapes - square, triangular, hexagonal - and range from ten to thirty feet in diameter. The ground level of the library is arranged into reading nooks and study desks like the other platforms.

Gravity. Gravity is subjective here. Characters can walk normally on staircases and platforms, even sideways or upside-down. Creatures levitate in midair instead of falling, but those lacking a flying speed must move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a railing or bookcase), which allows them to move as if they were climbing. Unattended objects float around randomly.

Soaring Intellect. A creature can fly and hover within the library with a speed equal to ten times its Intelligence modifier.

Tomes. Herein are books on every conceivable topic, from artworks, history, natural philosophy, magical matters, mathematics, and more. Among the books are introductory and advanced texts, exhaustive commentaries on those texts, poignant commentaries on those commentaries, scathing refutations of that commentary, a rebuttal to refutations of the commentaries, treatises that purportedly reinvent the topics altogether, and many works of complete fiction and utter fantasy.

Spellbooks. The library contains multiple tomes detailing every spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list in the Core Rules (and many more beyond) with the notable exceptions of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xNM9CzQQr2CieM4B], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.h830iyqParFleNqR], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jccbeBIfLrqEZnDP], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XbwGq5kDJNvAxNXV], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz], and the new spells described in Appendix D.

“I've been to a couple Academy strongholds, none of them felt welcoming, this one feels less so.”

— Sebastian Crowe

Shattered Breach

Looking above from the library, characters can see the breach in the tower. Visible are the remains of that section of the library, where the stairs, shelves, and platforms still shift and move, but in a field of wrecked debris. A crackingly storm of eldritch lightning erupts between the gently floating debris, cast adrift gently in space, defying gravity.

  • The breach is a one-hundred-fifty-foot-wide gap in the library. Traversing the breach requires flight, but there are several stray shelves, platforms, and stairs creatures can rest upon.
  • Chunks of delerium and meteoric iron hover about the air, interacting with the magic within.
  • Gravity remains broken in the breach, and creatures may still fly via soaring intellect.
  • A creature who ends its turn in the breach rolls 1d6. On a 1, it's struck by eldritch lightning. It must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10d6 lighting damage, or half as much on a successful save.
  • Casting a spell in the breach automatically triggers an @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{Arcane Anomaly}.

Director's Office

Behind an impressive set of double doors is the director's audience chamber. Opposite the entrance to this circular room is a sumptuous obsidian throne flanked by iron candelabras. The sigil of the Amethyst Academy decorates the wall overhead, and the marble floor depicts a complex planar astrolabe. Overhead, a chandelier of steel and copper rings gently rotates, showing the movement of the celestial spheres. On either side of the throne is an arched iron door.

  • This room is located on one of the topmost floors of the tower, just below the Nexus.
  • The archmages of the Amethyst Academy keep personal chambers within the Inscrutable Tower merely as a formality: all maintain private @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xNM9CzQQr2CieM4B]{Demiplanes} as their primary abodes. Instead, this room serves as a meeting place to conduct business with others.

The left door opens outside the tower itself. As the door opens, a glimmering balcony of magical force takes shape that rings the entire tower with a narrow walkway five feet wide. There is a heaving lurch, as panels in the outer wall swing open below. A great telescope of glass and bronze emerges from within, supported by a metallic crane that moves it into position over the balcony. A chair is built into the side of the telescope, upon which are several intricate switches and levers.

  • Controls on the telescope allow it to be moved and rotated around the tower.
  • Several runes on the telescope play back a record of past observations. The last rune indicates a record was made the day the meteor struck, indicating that the archmage only became aware of the meteor in the final moments before it struck.

The right door opens into a smaller circular chamber where a round granite slab hovers three feet off the ground. Splayed out over it are all manner of missives, magical implements, and occult instruments. Glass shelves holding arcane components and books line the walls.

  • Treasure. This is a tuning fork keyed to the mortal plane, the material focus for a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz] spell. Scrolls of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.L4J89JXqbKs6puEV] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Y7uWUO4yqUN0JKl0] and a very rare magic item can be found here.
  • A sealed chest in this chamber contains the components needed to repair the clocktower, including an ancient (pre-meteor) delerium crystal in a preserved glass sphere.

Nexus

A gigantic and incomprehensible arcane apparatus whirs, clicks, and hums upon an obsidian plinth at the centre of this chamber. Revolving rings of brass, rotating golden plates embossed with diagrams of magical formula, whirling crystal lenses, spinning bronze rings etched with markings bearing out the movement of the planes, receptacles bearing lambent glass orbs of various colours and sizes, and delicate brass instruments orbit around a pulsing sphere of collecting energy. It glows with a strange prismatic light as it erratically convulses and emits spasmodic arcs of arcane plasma that send shudders and shakes through the room.

Surrounding the machine are eight massive cushioned chairs held aloft by articulated bronze arms. Levers, buttons, switches, and plates that glow with magical runes are built into the armrests, and an array of telescoping apertures and lenses are affixed to the headrests with jointed metal rods. Seated within each is a warped and barely recognizable lifeless body.

The ceiling is a massive dome made from interlocking glass panes in organic shapes, each which gazes upon a different alien sky. Booming lightning crackles above. The rest of the room is ringed with shelves holding jars of spell components and eldritch curiosities.

  • This is the topmost level of the Inscrutable Tower.
  • The nexus contains a dimensional rift that has become unstable due to the damage caused by the meteor. The nexus must be rebooted to stabilize the dimensional rift.
  • Rebooting the nexus requires each of the eight chairs be disengaged and shut down. A creature seated in the chair can use an action to manipulate the apparatus. Doing so takes an action and DC 20 Arcana, Investigation, or Sleight of Hand check. Checks can also be made with tinker's tools or thieves' tools.
  • On a failed check, the creature suffers 4d6 psychic damage from backlash. Failure by 5 or more causes the creature to become stunned for 1 round.
  • Each attempt immediately triggers an @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{Arcane Anomaly}.
  • After the first chair is reset, on the following round on initiative count 20, 1d6 random extraplanar creatures are conjured by the erratic interference of the machine being partially on and partially off.
  • Once all eight chairs are successfully disengaged and shut down, the nexus powers down and the dimensional rift becomes stable.

Deep Cells

The floor of this forty-foot-wide obsidian chamber contains only a twenty-foot-wide cylindrical shaft lined with rows of hexagonal cells arrayed in a honeycomb.

  • This is the bottom chamber of the Inscrutable Tower, but space warps around itself, and it can only be accessed from a stairway opposite the Director's Office that seems to impossibly lead back down the entire tower.
  • The cylindrical shaft descends one thousand feet into the earth before ending in an immobile @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.2YNqk5zm9jDTvd7q]. All in all, there are over eighty thousand cells here.
  • Two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z3gSIXHHWYaHjfBT]{Stone Golems} stationed here as guards have gone berserk, and attack any who enter the chamber.
  • A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb] once covered the opening of the shaft, but the magic has failed. Fortunately, most of the other defensive features of the cells remain intact:

Cells. Each cell is a hexagonal cavity about ten feet wide and ten feet deep. An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ] fills each, and either a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb] or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jmfu8zj4zjjzUbeh] covers the opening. An arcane rune identifying the contents of the cell hovers in the air before the wall. A destroyed wall reforms one round later.

Keys. The magical wards upon each cell are individually keyed to a specific person, a password, and a token, and are manipulated by providing two of the keys and then speaking a command word within ten feet of the corresponding cell. The command words and their effects are as follows:

  • Secure. Raises the wall and activates the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ].
  • Release. Lowers the wall.
  • Disengage. Deactivates the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ].
  • Discharge. Lowers the wall and deactivates the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ], then causes a blast of force to violently expel the contents of the cell into the shaft, where they fall into the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.2YNqk5zm9jDTvd7q] below.

Each token is a magical trinket and could be almost any kind of object, but each always bears an invisible arcane rune that identifies the corresponding cell. Thousands of such objects are scattered about the Inscrutable Tower.

The exact contents of the cells are best left to the imagination, but they could contain all manner of extraplanar entities, fiends, and magical artefacts. Given the variety of creatures and objects stored within, it isn't uncommon for unique specimens to have specific safeguards.

Developments

The Tower Reclaimed. While it will be some time before the tower can be repaired and brought to a fully operational state again, accomplishing this major objective allows the Academy to move on to the next stage of their plans for Drakkenheim.

  • The Amethyst Academy will permit a player character who is a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard that can cast spells of 6th level or higher and opts to formally join the Amethyst Academy to carry the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017] on a mission to Castle Drakken that requires it.
  • The Amethyst Academy offers three very rare magic items in exchange for the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017] to groups who wish to keep it. If this offer is refused, they may attempt to steal it back.

Stolen Tower. Simply holding the Inscrutable Tower and the staff hostage is enough to stay the hand of the Amethyst Academy in the short term, who are terrified of losing such a precious resource. A cunning foe could extort the Academy for all its worth by doing so. Although @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] might enact a last-ditch effort by launching a few schemes to reclaim the tower, if he's defeated, the distant Academy Directorate takes the long view and resorts to appeasement.

“This is why we don't build anything tall in Caspia. The bigger they are the harder they fall...or float.”

— Pluto Jackson

Saint Selina's Monastery.name: 圣赛莉娜修道院
Saint Selina's Monastery.text:
圣赛莉娜修道院

这座与世隔绝的避难所坐落在一座小山上，俯瞰着城市南边部分的德兰河。最初它建造的时候，德拉肯海姆还只占据了河流的北岸，随着时间推移，城市街道在修道院的周围逐渐成型。它是神圣之火的神职人员们的主要住所，他们负责整个德拉肯海姆的大小教堂。几百位信徒和祭司在高墙后面粗陋的房间中过着简朴而安适的生活。

@UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 和她的关系最紧密的信众们在完成第一次天火朝圣之后不久在开始聚集在这里。这一区域完全被浓厚污霭所覆盖，周围的水域也受到了污染，但那些完成圣礼之人不会受到这些危险的影响，能够在德拉肯海姆正常休息。因此，这座原本防御薄弱的修道院成为了最虔诚的天火信众们的理想避难所。现在，大约有一百位受过圣礼的天火信众居住在修道院内，但在修道院外的肮脏营地里还有数百人。

“我发誓我能在地图上找到这个地方，但真的到那里又是另一回了。”

—— 塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

互动

天火信众们生活在一个紧密的社群中，彼此知根知底。这里的每一个人都参加了圣礼。

拜访修道院

防御

天火信众们很大程度上属于没什么组织的状态，随意地在修道院里生活，因为他们知道很少有人敢靠近他们在污霭中的避难所，所以他们十分安全。不过，在每扇正门和通往回廊的通道处都有一队由六名@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信徒} 和@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士}组成的小队看守。

庇护祝福 Blessings of Protection： 。卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯用永久的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.F6YxyeyONp392242]{圣居} 和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.CGhf4cQJJ4Ah7EnB]{禁制术} 法术守护着修道院的回廊、塔楼和小教堂。当一个并非天火信众的生物进入这一区域时，其必须成功通过 DC20 的魅力豁免，否则当它留在区域内时会处于恐慌状态。成功的情况下，直到离开修道院为止它都无视这一状态。当天火之盆仍在小教堂中燃烧时，这些效应无法消除。

区域详述

圣赛莉娜修道院是一座宽敞的建筑，由两条毗邻的方形回廊组成，在回廊中间矗立着一座六十尺高的卫戍塔，以及旁边的神圣之火小教堂。大部分建筑由抹灰的砂岩建造，顶上有倾斜的褐色屋顶，只有20 尺高。

修道院花园

修道院围墙 Monastery Walls： 环形的多圈草坪和 10尺高的石墙环绕着修道院的地面部分。两扇铁门后面，碎石小路通往修道院的入口处。

  • 每扇门 都有 4 名@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信徒} 和 1 名@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士}把守。

花园 Gardens：这些花园曾经郁郁葱葱，宁静祥和。但现在花已经枯萎，化作灰烬。树已经死去，只留下石化的植物。

信众的帐篷 Follower's Tents： 一个由几十顶帆布帐篷组成的临时营地塞满了圣赛莉娜修道院的花园。

  • 白天，[[/r 10d10]] 名接受了圣礼的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信徒} 会在这些昏暗的帐篷和臭气熏天的棚屋中，聚集在简陋篝火边。但晚上，数百人会挤在这里，睡在这些肮脏至极的环境中。

回廊

每个回廊都有一条 10 尺宽的柱廊，围绕着一块方形的庭院。遮阳篷顶下的瓷砖小路便装点着石头凳子和褪色已久的壁画。

入口通道 Entrance Passages: 每一条回廊都有一道 10 尺宽带顶棚的通道，可以通过沉重的橡木门进入。它们白天开放，晚上禁止进入。

  • 每个入口都由一位皈依天火的随军@UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn]{牧师 chaplain} 带领着四名@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士} 站岗看守。

庭院 Courtyard： 回廊的中心都是一片宽阔的草坪，上面碎石小路纵横交错。高高的、早已枯死的石化树木从修道院的屋顶上伸出，而草坪里现在只剩下枯萎的灌木了。北面庭院的中心是一口带盖子的井，从城市的水渠中取水。令人惊讶的是，这口井仍然可使用。另一个回廊的中心是一眼圆形的温泉，上面装饰着天使的塑像。

  • 每个庭院里都有 [[/r 10d6]] 个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qkLNA1lKMMJpxuWg]{邪教徒} 在冥想或祈祷。

僧侣的房间 Monk's Cells： 沿着每一圈回廊的其中三面排布着十几个房间。这些实用的石头房间只有摇摇晃晃的木门，很少上锁，里面整洁而朴实无华。

每个房间宽度不超过 10 尺，长度不超过 15尺，里面有两套带粗纺床单的稻草床垫、一张写字台、一只水桶和一个背包，里面装着每人一套的额外衣服，还有几个烛台。房间有两个能向外看的小窗户，每一排房间都有一道后门，通往被 4 尺的围墙包围的废弃菜园。

缮写室 Scriptorium： 天火信众们在这个房间里搭起了两台从南城区废墟中抢救出来的印刷机。这儿曾经是修道院的图书馆和缮写室。他们已经处理掉了满书架被毁的书籍，为印刷模具、羊皮纸、墨水瓶、样板和装订用品腾出了空间。

  • 十二位 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{狂信邪教徒} 夜以继日地制作《天火圣约》的印刷本或描述卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯主张的小册子。完成的印刷本会被整齐地放进附近的板条箱和货车之中，运送到外面的世界。

公共大厅 Common Hall： 这间大厅里有三排长桌，桌边摆着木头长椅。天火信众会在厨房里准备简单的肉汤和稀粥。

院长塔

这座 60 尺高的塔楼有四层，木头地板吱嘎作响。其中一层被用作卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯自己的住处，其他的则用于冥想和会议。和她的追随者一样，她靠着一张简朴的稻草床铺和一张写字台维持着简朴的生活条件。地板上其他的地方则放着从缮写室搬来的卷轴和神学文本。

  • 当@UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08]没有亲自领导陨石坑边缘的朝圣或者在庭院里布道时，她会在塔楼里创作新作品。她每天晚上都会在这儿休息。
  • 这里保存着 [[/r 1d4]] 张极珍稀 的来自牧师法术列表的法术卷轴。
  • 六位 @UUID[Actor.SMiupa0DgaBQbmmU]{圣骑士 cavalier} ——他们过去是神圣之火的圣武士，如今皈依了天火，作为卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的个人守卫守护着这座塔楼。在任何时候，都有两位在睡觉，两位在巡逻，两位在门口站岗。

圣赛莉娜小教堂

这座小教堂毗邻主回廊，可以从庭院中进入。这是一座圆形建筑，有着同样的圆顶。

小教堂 Chapel： 中心的黄铜火盆之中，UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplContinualF]{不灭明焰} 在不断燃烧。只要这个火盆依然明亮，守卫修道院的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.F6YxyeyONp392242]{圣居} 和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e_collection_2024.phb-content.Item.CGhf4cQJJ4Ah7EnB]{禁制术} 效果就不会消除。

墓穴 Crypts： 当天火信众的一位接受过圣礼的成员死亡时，信众们会收集他们的妄质魂石，将它们存放在墓穴之中，和圣赛莉娜的遗体一同。

  • 卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯召唤来两个@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.hrWJwKEi5FP0WiaX]{异界神侍} 担任墓穴的守护者。
  • 天火信众们将 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.HelT000000000025] 存放在此处。

Camp Dawn.name: 黎明营地
Camp Dawn.text:
Camp Dawn

A few miles southwest of Drakkenheim is a recently con- structed fortified encampment. Just outside the furthest edge of the Haze, here the Knights of the Silver Order have established their base of operations for their sacred mission in Drakkenheim. @UUID[Actor.q4jRqiq5PgWcqvxD] has set up his command post, and runs the camp with strong military discipline grounded in fiery faith.

Interactions

Camp Dawn can accommodate five hundred soldiers, support staff, and stockpiled supplies, as well as stabling hundreds of draft animals, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.T1xZTDCGuvMBSq8d]{Warhorses}, and flying mounts. Not everyone here is a warrior, however: many are labourers, cooks, and clergy that assist the fighting force and run the day-to-day tasks around camp. Nevertheless, dozens of Silver Order strike teams are resting, training, or resupplying here at any one time, in addition to the posted guards in the areas described below, representing two-thirds of the Silver Order's total forces in Drakkenheim.

The encampment operates under the same military standard one would expect from a front-line fortress on the eve of battle against a dangerous and duplicitous foe. The knights maintain a detailed roster of their personnel and equipment, with many checks and balances in place to follow up on missing patrols or misplaced gear.

Visiting the Camp

Any visitors approaching the gates are required to state their business. Those granted entry must disarm, and are escorted by a Silver Order @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO] or several @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} wherever they go within the camp. The Silver Order is hospitable to those who are wounded or need help, but always treats any guests with caution. Allies of the Silver Order are recognized by the gate guards and may freely move about the camp, and may even be offered their own tent. Those who wish to speak with the Knight-Captain are escorted to the Command Post.

Defenses

The encampment is in a perpetual state of readiness, and the rank-and-file respond to any attack, intrusion, or infiltration by quickly banding together and raising a general alarm. Every single guard on duty carries a horn, and specific calls are used to alert the camp upon the discovery of a fire, sabotage, slain guards, intruders, attackers, or all clear. These can be heard throughout the camp, and 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights} rush to the site in short order, with many more to follow

“An impressive armada designed to invade a city. I do not believe they know what they're up against.”

— Pluto Jackson

Area Details

Camp Dawn has a tall wooden palisade wall surrounded with a ditch filled with water and sharpened stakes. At each corner is anchored a defended guard tower. Entry into the camp is by four gates — one at each cardinal direction. Each gate is flanked by towers, with a wooden bridge leading over the ditch to the wooden doors. Inside, the camp is an array of activities. Most of the enclosure is filled with neatly organized rows of large canvas tents, grouped around small cooking fires and supply carts.

  • The main walls of the camp are constructed by double-layered wooden logs. Each log is twelve to fourteen feet long and ends in a spike. Stone and gravel have been piled along the base of the wall for reinforcement.
  • A ditch fifteen feet deep and ten feet wide has been dug around the entire perimeter like a moat. The trench is filled with sharpened wooden spikes and knee deep water. There is a sturdy wooden bridge over the trench leading to the camp gates.
  • Along the interior of the walls is a rampart made of wooden scaffolding. 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} patrol between each tower, each carrying heavy crossbows.

[1] Supply Wagons

There is a constant flow of wagons entering and leaving the camp. More arrive each day to keep the encampment freshly stocked with food, water, weapons, equipment, and other necessities. The ministry of the Sacred Flame funds the Knights of the Silver Order, so little gold or currency travels directly through the camp.

  • Wagons are usually protected by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO] or 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards}, and driven by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq].

[2] Guard Towers

Two towers flank each entrance into the camp, and one reinforces each corner. The square structures are built from thick wooden logs with ladders ascending from the ground. The defended platform rises about thirty feet off the ground with wooden stanchions and a pointed wooden rooftop.

  • Each tower has 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO] and 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} equipped with horns and crossbows.

[3] Rookery Towers

A round wood and brick tower sits in the southwest of the camp. Large arched windows circle around its exterior, and a wooden platform perches out from each. Ropes and ladders provide access to the tower. This tower has several nests for the griffon mounts of the Silver Order.

  • Two dozen adult griffons are found here at any given time.
  • A @UUID[Actor.SMiupa0DgaBQbmmU] and 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights} stand guard.

[4] Stables

A long wooden building has been constructed along one of the walls of the fort. Two barn doors on each end open to a central aisle with rows of fenced stalls on each side, each filled with hay and a water trough.

  • About 40 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.T1xZTDCGuvMBSq8d]{Warhorses} are housed here at any given time. A staff of a dozen stablehands (human @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoners}) tends the horses, and 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO] and 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} patrol nearby.

[5] Infirmary

A long short square wooden building in the northwest of the camp acts as a hospice for injured knights. The building has a warm fire inside and many cots and tables. 2d6 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CHEUjiYrVM9X0vIT]{Acolytes} and a @UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn] are taking care of the injured. At any given time, 1d6 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights} are resting here recovering from contamination and other injuries.

  • A small stockpile of 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.ytlsBjYsZ7OBSEBs]{Potions of Healing} are kept here, along with 1d4 scrolls of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MOEmz9N0j0QPkKEE], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008], greater restoration each.

[6] Pyre of the Sacred Flame

A large pyre burns ever brightly at the heart of Camp Dawn. This consecrated bonfire is lit by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MK6gpQMeDFo0cP9f] and emits a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SLxA9QhrggTz0taU] spell effect. The flame is surrounded by several wooden benches

and prayer mats. This is not a place for meals or cooking. It is a place of worship; a shrine constructed in the field so the faithful knights may contemplate their duty to the Sacred Flame.

  • Each morning, High Flamekeeper @UUID[Actor.1IaDUyBM9G4EEphL] leads prayers and hymns around the pyre, a ceremony that usually lasts about an hour. Everyone not on duty attends these gatherings. Theodore Marshal is often in attendance.
  • During the rest of the day, another @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1] and 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CHEUjiYrVM9X0vIT]{Acolytes} tend the pyre, and often others in the camp will stop here to make their own personal prayers.

[7] Knight's Tents

The northern half of the camp comprises eighty tents in neatly organized rows. Each tent has four bunks for sleeping staff or soldiers. Each keeps their belongings in satchels or small footlockers within. Most are occupied during the night, but empty during the day. Each cluster of tents keeps their own stoves or cooking fires.

Amongst all the tents, there are all manner of martial weapons, ammunition, suits of medium armour, and shields. Each tent typically sleeps one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO] and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} of their retinue.

[8] Flamekeeper's Tents

These larger tents are set up next to the infirmary. Each is decorated with silver trim and is equipped with one to four cots, a small stove, a desk with a chair, and a chest for belongings.

  • These tents are used by the clergy of the Sacred Flame who reside in the camp: @UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn]{Chaplains} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{Priests}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CHEUjiYrVM9X0vIT]{Acolytes}, and High Flamekeeper @UUID[Actor.1IaDUyBM9G4EEphL].
  • 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights} are posted as guards for the Flamekeepers at all times.

[9] Command Post

The command post is a large open tent that sits just off the pyre. Inside is a large meeting table that can sit most officers in the regiment, with a map of Drakkenheim unrolled upon it. Several wooden figures are set on the map showing plans and tactics for military operations.

  • 4 @UUID[Actor.SMiupa0DgaBQbmmU]{Cavaliers} stand guard at the command post at all times, but typically the tent is abuzz with activity. Theodore Marshal is usually here during the day, conferring with several @UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn]{Chaplains}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{Priests}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights}, Silver Order strike teams, or @UUID[Actor.1IaDUyBM9G4EEphL].

Knight-Captain's Tent. This large tent in the southeast of the camp is decorated with lavish designs and silver filigree. The symbol of the Sacred Flame hangs on a banner next to the entrance. Inside are animal fur rugs, a large wardrobe, a locked chest, a simple bed, and a seldom-used writing desk.

  • This is the private tent of Theodore Marshal. 2 @UUID[Actor.SMiupa0DgaBQbmmU]{Cavaliers} are assigned to guard the Knight-Captain at all times.

Stockpile

About five hundred feet from the main camp is a wooden shed that has been constructed in a clear field. Inside the shed are several barrels and crates filled with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.FvNOwWbh5FXyX4xe] and oil. The shed is reinforced and locked, and clearly visible from the guard towers.

  • The shed is manned by 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knights} and 2d6 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards} patrol nearby at all times.

Court of Thieves.name: Court of Thieves
Court of Thieves.text:
Court of Thieves

Hidden deep under the city lies the stronghold of the Queen's Men, the Court of Thieves. Occasionally referred to as the Undertavern, it is the personal lair of the @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe]. While it could be near Buckledown Row, the placement of the Court of Thieves is up to you.

Interactions

Finding the Court of Thieves is a challenge all its own. Its location is a closely-kept secret only known to a small number of Queen's Men agents on a need-to-know basis: even @UUID[Actor.btuo8mywkRo5g6M9] himself doesn't really know where it's found.

Visiting the Court of Thieves

Named members of elite Queen's Men strike teams travel here occasionally. As such, following, interrogating, or tricking the Queen of Thieves' own strike teams is the best method for locating the court. Important prisoners and treasures seized by the Queen's Men agents eventually make their way back here. The player characters might be able to engineer an opportunity to lure out a strike team to track back to the court by using tantalizing bait.

Regardless, those who come to parley with the Queen of Thieves are presented with a fiendish puzzle before they are granted an audience (see the “Queen's Riddle” below).

Queen's Champions. A widely-circulating rumour claims that the Queen of Thieves grants a personal favour to any who defeat the arena champion, and so characters who made a name for themselves fighting in the rings of Buckledown Row might be invited to the Court of Thieves to test their mettle in the arena instead.

Defenses

The Court of Thieves focuses on security through obscurity. A Queen's Men strike team is usually on guard here. Devilish traps protect the inner sanctum of the Queen of Thieves.

“I used to know my way around, but the streets have changed. Is that even possible?”

— Sebastian Crowe

Area Details

Aquifer Junction

This circular aqueduct passage is inhabited by three @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.3YwmvDupMwycWNCO]{Giant Crocodiles}. They've been lured here deliberately to ward off snoops or intruders. They don't answer to any of the Queen's Men, but any of the faction members who regularly come here know to give them a wide berth.

The walkway along the sewer canal here is heavily damaged and has partially collapsed into the waterway. Huge blocks of stone and gravel are piled up, but the wall itself is completely intact.

  • A DC 15 Investigation check determines the walkway isn't collapsed: it's an intersection heading east blocked off with wreckage.
  • The wall here is an illusion created by a permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.nslx2nT3p4lNkmdp] spell cast by the Queen of Thieves. Creatures and objects simply pass through to a wooden staircase in the Undertavern.
  • Excavation equipment or magic would be needed to remove the wreckage.

Undertavern

This wide sewer passage has been transformed into a makeshift tavern. The main canal is drained, relatively dry, and blocked with debris in several places. Wooden planks hammered and lashed across the canal form bridges and decks above, accessible through ladder-like stairways. The broad upper sewer walkways have been cleared out to make room for about a dozen round tables with stools set around each. Hanging lanterns are strung up throughout to light the chamber, and a few coal stoves provide meager warmth. An impressive bar has been constructed, lined with barstools from which a curiously dapper mechanical barman serves ale and mead. At the far end of the tavern is a small band of ruffians performing lively music upon an improvised stage. Several rogues and thieves mingle about.

  • The canal continues east to another intersection, which heads north into a fog-shrouded tunnel and further east to a collapsed tunnel.
  • One or two Queen's Men strike teams are watchfully relaxing here most of the time. They aren't hostile to visitors, even enemies of the Queen of Thieves. Instead, they invite characters to share a drink with them and chat. Characters who inquire about seeing the Queen of Thieves are told to speak with the Barman.
  • The Barman is a mechanical creature with the game statistics of a medium-sized @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE]. He can serve and mix drinks with aplomb. He doesn't speak, but any mention of the Queen of Thieves prompts him to deliver a programmed response via the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7v06rdmUakoTk1LQ] spell (see the Queen's Riddle below).

Kitchen. Several wooden panels have been set up here to create a separate kitchen. Inside are several well-stocked pantries, and a pig roasts over a fire pit. Anyone is free to use the kitchen, there's no designated cook.

Secret Doors. Seams in the walls are noticeable by a creature within five feet who makes a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. Knocking on the wall causes the door to slide open, revealing spiral staircases to the Arena Level or the Prison.

Poisoned Passage

The canal exits the tavern into a ten-foot-wide arched tunnel shrouded by a menacing green vapour.

  • The mist is magical, but whether or not it is harmless is impossible to determine (see below). If dispersed by wind, it reappears one round later.
  • NPCs in the bar explain that beyond lies the audience chamber of the Queen of Thieves. They claim the mist contains a powerful toxin that will render anyone who isn't inoculated against it completely unconscious and unresponsive.
  • Those who wish to see the Queen uninvited must solve the Queen's Riddle given by the Barman first. Any who solve the riddle will become inoculated against the toxic mist, and may pass through safely.
  • Queen's Men agents and strike teams in the bar have been “inoculated” already as they've proven their loyalty to the Queen of Thieves.
  • What the NPCs don't know is that the mist is actually harmless, and the potion they drank was merely a placebo. However, since this is what they believe to be true, they aren't lying. They do not know the answer to the riddle or how the riddle works.

The Queen's Riddle

Recite the following carefully:

The barman gestures to the mist-filled passageway and speaks:

“The Queen of Thieves bids any who seek an audience drink to her true name.”

He then sets the following drinks upon the table before you:

  • A bottle of red wine....
  • a cask of yellow mead...
  • a jug of white milk...
  • a pot of black coffee...
  • and several empty drinking cups.

Then the barman speaks again:

“It's a drink more pure than water, and more deadly than poison. When you finish your drink, it fills your cup, but you'll die if it's all you have to drink.”

Solution

The entire riddle is a misdirection:

  • The liquids are non-magical, but each contains an undetectable reactive toxin.
  • A creature who drinks any of the liquids then walks into the mist activates the toxin.
  • The toxin causes the creature to fall unconscious for 8 hours or until they take damage, with no saving throw.
  • Unconscious characters are stripped and locked in the prison cells below.

The answer to the riddle is “nothing”, but speaking the answer prompts no response from the Barman. If someone drinks, he gestures towards the mist. The correct solution is to simply ignore all the drinks, and walk through the mist. It's not even necessary to drink from the empty cups.



Thieves' Throne Room

This sewer junction has been blocked off, drained, and cleaned to create a throne room. Most pillars are repurposed pipes and a large sewer grate rests in a depression in the centre of the room. The brick walls still bear the stains and discolourations of sewer water, though the scent of perfume fills the air. Fine tapestries and benches with well-worn but choice scavenged pillows are positioned along the walls, and hanging braziers illuminate the room. At the far side of the chamber is a large circular alcove illuminated by lanterns, upon which is an impressive stone throne. A throng of chattering and laughing guests lounge about the room, including all manner of ne'er do wells, dashing rogues, and sly charmers.

Courtiers. Most people in this chamber aren't real, and are instead the result of many carefully designed @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bA2sk9eMKBeY7EPD] spells. This illusory model audience is perfectly programmed to play along with the Queen of Thieves' charades: cavorting like affable flunkies, gasping dramatically, uproariously laughing, sneering, barking cruel insults, clapping enthusiastically, and otherwise performing as needed.

  • A Queen's Men strike team is positioned here whenever the Queen of Thieves holds an actual audience.

Throne. The Queen of Thieves is seldom here in person, and instead appears here via the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ePhRKHXRE7l1sEoQ] power of her resplendent desk in the office (Area X).

Trap Grate. This iron grate is an obvious trap. A button on the armrest of the throne and a hidden lever on one of the pillar pipes cause it to snap open suddenly. Any creature standing on it is deposited into the Arena Floor, where they land in a pool of deep water and suffer 4d6 damage from the fall.

Secret Doors. A depression in the wall here is noticeable with a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. Knocking on the wall causes the door to slide open to the guest rooms.

Guest Rooms. Offered to “guests” of the Queen of Thieves, these well-appointed bedchambers are in fact sufficiently insulated from the Haze thanks to their underground position. Depending on the nature of her company, the Queen of Thieves may place poisoned drinks and food here, or seal the doors with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{Arcane Locks} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935]{Glyphs of Warding}.

Rogue's Gallery

This circular room may have once been a cistern. Upon the walls are now dozens of immaculate paintings and artworks. Several passages lead from this room to other exits. One has a metallic door covered in stunningly complex mechanisms and locks. Beside it is a wooden wine cabinet. The other is rather nondescript.

  • Treasure. There are forty three paintings in this room. Seven are recognizable as authentic masterpieces by some of the greatest artists who ever lived and are worth 2,500 gp each, the rest are worth 250 gp each. Garnering the full value for each painting would require hosting an auction to attract a host of wealthy collectors, however.
  • Wine Cabinet. One of the alcoves of this room contains a wooden cabinet that holds twelve wine glasses and twenty two bottles of fine wine. Half contain real wine; two bottles are actually @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.bqZ6NTLDCUB98YjV]{Potions of Gaseous Form} disguised using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RvEqsD89Zvd5yex4] to appear nonmagical. The rest are poisoned.

    A creature who drinks from one must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ([[/r 10d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Only the Queen of Thieves knows which is which.

  • Shackled Door. At the bottom of a short stair is an impressive door covered in a massive array of mechanical gears, locks, keyholes, buttons, latches, and handles. Each is frustratingly complex and may be disarmed or picked with a DC 20 Dexterity (thieves' tools) check, which either reveals yet another compartment with even more locks or resets a previously opened lock. There's no real logic to the system, it's a useless distraction as the door leads nowhere. However, one of the keyholes is actually a thin tube that leads to the office, but only a creature physically small enough to enter the keyhole could detect it.

Queen's Gauntlet

Before you is a perfectly clean, featureless stone passage.

  • This long hallway snakes around before ending in an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{Arcane Locked} door (DC 30 to open).
  • This devilish trap was devised by the Queen of Thieves to defend her personal sanctum; the entire hall is lined with a dynamic mechanical and magical system. Roll initiative when characters move down this hallway. Each round on initiative count 20 and 10 (losing initiative ties) the Queen's Gauntlet activates one of the following defenses, which spring out from anywhere along the walls, floor, or ceiling:

Multiattack. The gauntlet makes two whirling blade or poisoned darts attacks, each against different targets within range.

  • Whirling Blade. Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) slashing damage.
  • Poisoned Darts. Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

Battering Ram (Recharge 5-6). A section of the wall springs open. Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be flung 20 feet away from the battering ram and knocked prone.

Snare (Recharge 5-6). A spinning bolas launches from a panel on the wall to ensnare one creature within 10 feet of any wall. The target must succeed on a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by sticky barbed wire. A restrained creature can escape by using an action to make a successful DC 17 Dexterity or Strength check.

Flame Jet (Recharge 5-6). A bronze nozzle pops from the wall shooting gouts of flame in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Pit Trap (5/day). A ten-foot by ten-foot trapdoor in the floor snaps open anywhere in the hallway more than five feet from another open trap door, leading to a fifty-foot-deep pit. Creatures standing on the floor in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or fall into the pit. On a successful save the creature leaps clear on the side of the pit (it can choose which). The bottom of the pit is different each time this ability activates:

  • Featureless. There's nothing at the bottom of this pit.
  • Acid Pool. The bottom of the pit is filled with a five-foot-deep pool of acid. A creature who starts its turn in the acid takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.
  • Spikes. The pit is lined with sharp spikes. A creature falling into the pit takes an additional 5d6 piercing damage.
  • Contaminated Water. The bottom of the pit is filled with contaminated water ten feet deep. A creature that ends its turn there must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of Contamination.
  • Liquid Hot Magma. Ten feet at the bottom of the pit is filled with lava. A creature who enters the pit or who starts its turn there takes 10d10 fire damage.

Portcullis (5/day). A heavy iron gate slams down from the ceiling above. Creatures below can make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw to leap clear on either side. A creature who fails this saving throw lands prone. Those who fail the save by 5 or more are instead crushed under the portcullis. The creature suffers 5d6 bludgeoning and 5d6 piercing damage, and becomes restrained under the portcullis until freed. A creature can lift the portcullis by using an action to make a successful DC 17 Strength check. It may also be attacked and damaged; it has AC 20, 30 hit points, and is immune to psychic and poison damage.

Nerve Gas (2/day). The hallway releases a deadly neurotoxin. Each creature in the hall must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magical gas. On a failed save, the target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. In addition, it can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for one minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Countermeasures

Characters can use whatever means at their disposal to defend themselves, or simply take the Dash or Dodge actions and hope for the best, or try the following:

Perception. On its turn, a creature can spend an action to examine the area around it for signs of traps with a successful DC 17 Perception check. On a successful check, either the next saving throw it makes against the trap automatically succeeds, or the next attack roll made against it by the trap automatically misses.

Disarm. A creature can attempt to disable one of the gauntlet's systems. It chooses which action it wants to disarm and makes a DC 22 Dexterity (thieves' tools) check. On a successful check, the mechanism is disabled for one minute. On a failed check, the creature accidentally triggers the mechanism.

“Respect where it is due although the crown belongs to the youngest as the older generation has been corrupted by greed and madness.”

— Pluto Jackson

The Office

Beyond the door is a tidy and luxurious office paneled with wood and bookshelves. Three bronze candelabras illuminate the chamber with soft ember light. A mahogany desk sits in the middle of the room with a sumptuous upholstered chair behind and two fine wooden chairs before it. Atop are several neatly stacked papers and journals, a lamp, and a box of fine fountain pens. Several large framed mirrors hang on the wall opposite the desk and to the left and right side of the room. A model globe rests in one corner, and in the other is a petrified wingback chair fixed to the floor.

A mental @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7p9IuWrSWFgfyQo2] spell notifies the Queen of Thieves whenever someone enters this chamber.

Bookshelves. Gothic novels, play scripts, and other fiction involving dastardly criminals, tricksters, and other villains are found here. Written in the margins of each text are commentaries left by a genre-savvy reader about the many mistakes made by the villain in the story. Occasionally, particularly clever reversals made by the heroes are circled in red ink.

Mirrors. These magical mirrors are positioned such that anyone seated at the desk may see behind themselves and observe others in the room from every angle. In addition, the reflections of invisible creatures and objects are visible in the mirrors, which also reveal the true nature of any illusions or shapechangers. Hidden behind one of the mirrors is the end of a thin tube that connects to the Shackled Door in the Rogue's Gallery.

Resplendent Desk. Kept in the desk drawers are comprehensive dossiers on each of the player characters, faction leaders, and lieutenants. Not only do these notes detail virtually everything about their capabilities and exploits thus far, within may be secrets unknown even to the player characters themselves. The desk and chair are magical; a creature sitting at the desk on the chair can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ePhRKHXRE7l1sEoQ] to a range of 300 feet.

Petrified Wingback. A creature who sits on this stone chair is immediately teleported as if by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A4RsPuSvB9wFtz1j] to an identical-looking chamber (see below). In that moment, the teleported creature sees an illusion of any other creatures in the room being disintegrated, while those creatures see an illusion of the teleported creature having its flesh painfully seared away, leaving behind nothing but a blackened skeleton that crumbles into ash if touched. Looking at the skeleton through the mirrors in the room reveals it to be an illusion.
